RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Klenio Barbosa possui graduao em Economia pela Universidade de So Paulo (2000), mestrado pela Pontifcia Universidade Catlica do Rio de Janeiro (2003), e doutorado em Economia pela Toulouse School of Economics (2010). Atualmente professor de finanas da SKEMA Business School (Brasil, EUA, Frana e China), onde leciona as disciplinas sobre estratgia empresarial, organizao industrial, banking e finanas. Tambm pesquisador do Centro de Pesquisa FAIRR (Finance and Accounting Insights on Risk and Regulation) e pesquisador associado da Universit Cte d'Azur da Frana. Tem experincia na rea de Economia, com nfase em Regulao, Contrataes Pblicas, Microeconomia Bancria e Finanas Corporativas.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Klenio has B.A. in Economics from Universidade de So Paulo (2000), master degree in Economics from Pontifcia Universidade Catlica do Rio de Janeiro (2003), and Ph.D. in Ecnomics from Toulouse School of Economics (Universit Toulouse 1 Capitole (2010)). He is currently a finance professor at SKEMA Business School (Brazil, China, France and USA), where he teaches Corporate Strategies and Industrial Structures, Banking, Financial Markets and Institutions and International Finance. He is also a member of FAIRR (Finance and Accounting Insights on Risk and Regulation) research center, and associate researcher at the Universit Cte d'Azur, France. His research interest are regulation, procurement, banking and corporate finance.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Escola de Economia de So Paulo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Apesar de contratos de baixa potncia no fornecerem os incentivos corretos para reduzir custo, a evidncia emprica mostra que eles so frequentemente usados tanto em licitaes pblicas quanto privadas. Este trabalho mostra que contratos de baixa potncia surgem em equilbio devido a existnica do problema do carona no desenho de licitaes quando a empresa contratada possui economias de escopo/escala quando trabalhando para diveros contratantes. Um contratante, que individualmente oferece contratos de licitao para o contratante, no plenamente internaliza o fato que ao oferecer contratos de alta potncia est incentivando a reduo de custos em outras atividades do contratante. Entretanto, ele internaliza todos os custos associados a tal esquema de incentivo. Uma vez que o benefcio privado de contratos de alta potncia menor que o seu benefcio privado, contratantes oferecero contratos com menor potncia em equilbrio. O modelo prediz que quanto maior o nmero de atividades que um contratante exerce para diferentes contratantes, menor a potnica dos contratos de licitaes..
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Low-powered contracts do not provide proper incentives to reduce cost; still empirical studies show that they are quite pervasive in public and private procurement. This paper argues that low-powered contracts arise due to a free-riding problem when the contractor enjoys economies of scale/scope working for different buyers. A buyer, offering a procurement contract to the contractor, does not fully internalize that higher-powered incentives provides cost reduction in the contractor?s activities, benefiting other buyers. As a result, buyers offer lower-powered contracts than what would be designed by cooperative buyers. Strikingly, the higher the contractor?s benefits from economies of scope/scale are; the lower the power of the procurement contracts is. In addition, laws which oblige buyers to award fixed-price contracts can be welfare-enhancing.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Escola de Economia de So Paulo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Discrimination in Dynamic Procurement Design with Learning-by-doing
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Discriminatory programs that favor local and small firms in government procurement are common in many countries. This paper studies the long-run impact of procurement discrimination on market structure and future competition in industries where learning-by-doing makes incumbent firms more efficient over time. We consider a sequential procurement design problem in which local and global firms compete for public good provision. Both firms benefit from learning-by-doing if they provide the public good in the previous period but global firms only may be able to transfer learning-by-doing from different markets. We find that the optimal procurement has to be biased in favor of the local firm even when all firms are symmetric with respect to their initial cost distribution. This bias fosters future competition and reduces intertemporal expected transfers to providers.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: The Brazilian System of Price Registration and its Benefits: An Empirical Analysis of the Public Purchases of Drugs and Medical Instruments
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O Sistema Brasilero de Registro de Preos (RP) um sistema de aquisio de bens e contratao de servios pblicos implantado pelo governo brasileiro em 2001, no qual empresas disponibilizam os bens e servios a preos e prazos registrados em ata especfica. A aquisio ou contratao feita quando melhor convier aos rgos/entidades pblicas que integram o processo. Trabalhos toricas, por exemplo Barbosa(2010), sugerem que, quando houver algum ganho de escala na produo, distribuio ou logstica de certos bens e servios, rgos e entidades pblicas que realizam compras atravs do RP podem comprar bens e servios a preos mais baixos. Por outro lado, outros trabalhos tericos, por exemplo Fiza (2007), sugerem que rgos/entidades pblicas com boa reputao de pagamento podem pagar preos mais elevados por bens e servios quando efetuam compram em conjunto com outros rgos/entidades pblicas com menor reputao atravs do RP. Este trabalho busca testar tais hipteses atravs de um anlise economtrica das compras governamentais brasileiras da rea da sade entre 2004 e 2009.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Free-Riding and Spillover in Procurement: Evidence from Public Transit Systems in France
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Barbosa (2010) mostra que contratos de baixa potncia surgem em equilbio devido a existnica do problema do carona no desenho de licitaes quando a empresa contratada possui economias de escopo quando trabalhando para diveros contratantes. Atravs de um modelo de econometria estrutural, este trabalho busca estimar os efeitos de economias de escopo e de carona no desenho de contratos de concesso de transporte pblico urbano dos muncipios da Frana.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Escola de Economia de So Paulo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Procurement and Public Officials Career Concerns
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This research project aims to study empirically le link between public officials' experience and career path and public procurement outcomes. Brazil is a perfect testing ground for these issues, because of the availability of a large amount of data on key aspects such as public purchases and individual careers. For this study, we will use in particular an extensive data set on the public procurement of health products together with a comprehensive data set tracing individual job experience and characteristics. Precisely, relying on such data set we aim at understanding how purchase administrators' career paths (past experience in the public or private sectors, or as a politician, etc) determine the procurement outcome: price paid by the government, the kind of procurement contracts used (invited bidders, restricted bidders, electronic auction), and some measures of mismanagement. In particular, we are interested in looking at so called "revolving door" issues (e.g., do some of these officials continue their career as supplier of the hospital that they previously managed, and in this case, do we observe that the purchase exhibits different patterns from the other kind of purchases). More generally, the movement of officials can be in two directions: first private and then public (they may favor a firm for which they worked previously as stated above), or first public and then private (they may favor a firm and then get a "good" job later in the firm which they favored previously).
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This research project aims to study empirically le link between public officials' experience and career path and public procurement outcomes. Brazil is a perfect testing ground for these issues, because of the availability of a large amount of data on key aspects such as public purchases and individual careers. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Procurement and Public Officials Career Concerns

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A central hypothesis in a principal-agent relation is that the principal always seeks to maximize profits. This paper studies incentives provision when the principal has multiple objectives besides profit maximization and the additional performance measure is costly to observe. The model used is a modification of the multitask model presented by Holmstrom and Milgrom (1991). As results, we find that the optimal contract changes accordingly to the correlation coefficient between the noise terms in the performance measurements. Besides that, not only a principal whose main concern is the second task, as a principal who has clear preferences for product, will willingly pay the observability cost of the additional performance measure when the correlation coefficient is positive.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Escola de Economia de So Paulo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Generic-Branded Drug Competition and the Price for Pharmaceuticals: New Evidence from Public Procurement Auctions in Brazil
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
his paper studies the effects of generic drug entry on bidding behavior of drug suppliers in procurement auctions, and the consequences on acquisition prices for pharmaceuticals by public bodies. Using a data set on procurement auctions for pharmaceuticals organized by Brazilian public bodies, we surprisingly find no statistically difference between bids and prices paid for generic and branded drugs. On the other hand, suppliers of branded drugs lower their bidding price in auctions in which there exists a supplier of generics. These findings explain why we find that the presence of any supplier of generic drugs in a tendering reduces the price paid for pharmaceuticals by 7 percent. This evidence indicates that generic competition affects branded supplier's behavior in public procurement auctions differently from other markets.
Research Grant N. 25000.180692/2011-52 granted by Samaritano Hospital/SUS/Ministry of Health
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
O objetivo do projeto analisar o efeito da lei dos genricos na compra pblica de medicamentos. A introduo da lei dos genricos no Brasil foi motivada pela potencial reduo no preo de medicamentos e/ou um conseqente aumento da quantidade comprada. Tais impactos possuem, em tese, impactos positivos sobre as contas pblicas e no acesso de medicamentos a populao. Contudo, so raros os estudos no Brasil que analisem o impacto de tal mudana na legislao sobre as finanas pblicas dos municpios. No contexto, o objetivo deste projeto estudar se a lei dos genricos permitiu uma reduo do preo de aquisio de medicamentos e/ ou um aumento da quantidade. Para desenvolver tal estudo, ser utilizada a base de dados do governo do estado de So Paulo, na qual h informao sobre o preo pago e quantidade compradas de medicamentos. Para avaliar os efeitos, sero empregadas as tcnicas economtricas de anlise de impacto de polticas pblicas amplamente difundidas na literatura internacional sobre o assunto. Atravs desse estudo, o governo, em todas as suas esferas, poder avaliar se a aquisio de medicamentos, na forma de genricos, lhe permite reduzir no preo pago e/ou aumentar a quantidade adquirida. A partir desses resultados, os governos sero capazes de gerenciar mais adequadamente os seus processos de compra.
Contrato Numero: 25000.180692/2011-52
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Gasto Pblico com a Aquisio de Produtos Genricos

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Campaign Donations and State Government Contracts in Brazil: Evidence from Regression-Discontinuity Design
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project aims to study the causal link between electoral victory and state government contracts acquired by campaign donor firms. The sample used was a data of 2005 state deputy elections from eight Brazilian states. The study has revealed that, observing the whole sample, the relationship between victory and contracts is statistical significant and economically relevant. However, when covariate balance and robust tests were applied, there is no evidence to establish a causal link between electoral victory and state contracts. In addition, it was observed the same results for specific groups separated by gender, education level and marital status.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This project aims to study the causal link between electoral victory and state government contracts acquired by campaign donor firms. The sample used was a data of 2005 state deputy elections from eight Brazilian states. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Interest Rates in Trade Credit Markets
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O objetivo do projeto entender por que a taxa de juros de crdito ao fornecedor raramente varia com caractersticas das devedoras, apesar de existir evidncia de que os fornecedores tm uma vantagem informacional sobre os bancos no que diz respeito situao de crdito de seus clientes.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
Despite strong evidence that suppliers of inputs are usually informed lenders, the cost of trade
credit rarely varies with borrowing firm characteristics. We solve this puzzle by demonstrating
that it is optimal for suppliers to keep riskier firms indifferent between trade credit and loans
from uninformed banks. Because these bank loans are likely to vary across industries but
not with firm characteristics, the same pattern applies to the cost of trade credit. The model
predicts that the cost of trade credit is more likely to vary with firm characteristics in industries
that are plagued by moral hazard problems or economic distress.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Interest Rates in Trade Credit Markets
